p: Gene sequencing is the most accurate and reliable technology for the detection of viruses and other pathogenic ‘emergency’ infectious diseases. Additionally, it is the only method to dynamically track genome variation in pathogens ( 28). In the early stage of the epidemic, the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention identified and analyzed the genome of 2019-nCoV based on second-generation sequencing metagenomics technology (mNGS) within five days and reported that the similarity between the nucleotide sequence of 2019-nCoV and SARS or bat-derived strains were 79 and 96%, respectively ( 9).
